intro: Chirripoa solitaria, commonly known as the solitary chirripoa, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adaptations to withstand the harsh, salty environment. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. Chirripoa solitaria is known for its small, pale yellow or white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
